subject: Education
title: Vygotsky's Zone of Proximal Development
description: A short lesson to help you apply Vygotsky's Zone of Proximal Development.

hook.text: A child can't tie shoes alone but does it perfectly with a nudge from Mom.

buildup.text: Vygotsky said learning lives between what you can do alone and what you can't do at all.

discovery.text: The zone of proximal development is the sweet spot where guided help works.

twist.text: Teaching below the zone is boring; above it is frustrating. Both kill motivation.

climax.text: Scaffolding means giving just enough support, then gradually removing it.

punchline.text: Great teaching meets you where you almost are.

quiz.question: What is the zone of proximal development?
options: The gap between what a learner can do alone and with help
The area of the brain responsible for language
A type of standardized test score
